title: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
author: William Shakespeare

scenes.name: The Street Fight
scenes.summary: A public brawl breaks out between the Montagues and Capulets, illustrating the deep-seated feud between the two families.
scenes.firstLine: Gregory, on my word, we'll not carry coals.
scenes.lastLine: If ever you disturb our streets again, Your lives shall pay the forfeit of the peace.

characters.name: Benvolio
characters.quote: I do but keep the peace. Put up thy sword, Or manage it to part these men with me.

characters.name: Tybalt
characters.quote: What, drawn, and talk of peace? I hate the word, As I hate hell, all Montagues, and thee.

scenes.name: The Capulet Ball
scenes.summary: Romeo sneaks into the Capulet's ball, where he meets and falls instantly in love with Juliet, igniting their tragic romance.
scenes.firstLine: Welcome, gentlemen! Ladies that have their toes Unplagu'd with corns will have a bout with you.
scenes.lastLine: My only love sprung from my only hate! Too early seen unknown, and known too late!

characters.name: Romeo
characters.quote: O, she doth teach the torches to burn bright!

characters.name: Juliet
characters.quote: My only love sprung from my only hate! Too early seen unknown, and known too late!

scenes.name: The Balcony Scene
scenes.summary: Romeo and Juliet declare their love for each other and vow to marry in secret, deepening their connection.
scenes.firstLine: But, soft! what light through yonder window breaks? It is the east, and Juliet is the sun.
scenes.lastLine: Sleep dwell upon thine eyes, peace in thy breast! Would I were sleep and peace, so sweet to rest!

characters.name: Romeo
characters.quote: With love's light wings did I o'erperch these walls;

characters.name: Juliet
characters.quote: And all my fortunes at thy foot I'll lay And follow thee my lord throughout the world.

scenes.name: Friar Laurence Agrees to Marry Romeo and Juliet
scenes.summary: Romeo convinces Friar Laurence to marry him and Juliet in an effort to reconcile their feuding families.
scenes.firstLine: The grey-ey'd morn smiles on the frowning night, Check'ring the Eastern clouds with streaks of light;
scenes.lastLine: Wisely and slow. They stumble that run fast.

characters.name: Romeo
characters.quote: Then plainly know my heart's dear love is set On the fair daughter of rich Capulet.

characters.name: Friar Laurence
characters.quote: In one respect I'll thy assistant be; For this alliance may so happy prove, To turn your households' rancour to pure love.

scenes.name: Tybalt Challenges Romeo
scenes.summary: Tybalt sends a letter to the Montague household, challenging Romeo to a duel as a consequence of Romeo attending the Capulet's ball.
scenes.firstLine: But I can give thee more; For I will raise her statue in pure gold,
scenes.lastLine: For never was a story of more woe Than this of Juliet and her Romeo.

characters.name: Tybalt
characters.quote: This intrusion shall, Now seeming sweet, convert to bitt'rest gall.

characters.name: Benvolio
characters.quote: Tybalt, the kinsman to old Capulet, Hath sent a letter to his father's house.

scenes.name: The Secret Marriage
scenes.summary: Romeo and Juliet are secretly married by Friar Laurence, hoping their union will end the feud between their families.
scenes.firstLine: So smile the heavens upon this holy act, That after-hours with sorrow chide us not!
scenes.lastLine: These violent delights have violent ends And in their triumph die, like fire and powder, Which, as they kiss, consume.

characters.name: Romeo
characters.quote: Ah, Juliet, if the measure of thy joy Be heap'd like mine, and that thy skill be more To blazon it, then sweeten with thy breath This neighbour air.

characters.name: Juliet
characters.quote: Conceit, more rich in matter than in words, Brags of his substance, not of ornament. They are but beggars that can count their worth; But my true love is grown to such excess, I cannot sum up sum of half my wealth.

characters.name: Friar Laurence
characters.quote: These violent delights have violent ends And in their triumph die, like fire and powder, Which, as they kiss, consume.

scenes.name: Mercutio's Death
scenes.summary: A confrontation between Mercutio and Tybalt escalates, leading to Mercutio's death, which becomes the catalyst for Romeo's vengeance.
scenes.firstLine: I am hurt. A plague o' both your houses! I am sped.
scenes.lastLine: Help me into some house, Benvolio, Or I shall faint. A plague o' both your houses!

characters.name: Mercutio
characters.quote: A plague o' both your houses!

characters.name: Tybalt
characters.quote: Mercutio, thou consort'st with Romeo.

characters.name: Romeo
characters.quote: This day's black fate on more days doth depend; This but begins the woe others must end.

scenes.name: Romeo Avenges Mercutio's Death
scenes.summary: In a rage, Romeo kills Tybalt as retribution for Mercutio's death, sealing his own fate and further deepening the family feud.
scenes.firstLine: Alive in triumph, and Mercutio slain! Away to heaven respective lenity, And fire-ey'd fury be my conduct now!

characters.name: Romeo
characters.quote: O, I am fortune's fool!

scenes.name: Romeo's Banishment
scenes.summary: Prince Escalus decrees Romeo's banishment from Verona as punishment for the bloodshed, exacerbating the tragedy of Romeo and Juliet's situation.
scenes.firstLine: Immediately we do exile him hence. I have an interest in your hate's proceeding, My blood for your rude brawls doth lie a-bleeding;
scenes.lastLine: Mercy but murders, pardoning those that kill.

characters.name: Prince Escalus
characters.quote: Immediately we do exile him hence.

scenes.name: Juliet Longs for Romeo
scenes.summary: Unaware of the day's tragic events, Juliet eagerly awaits her wedding night, only to have her world shattered by news of Tybalt's death and Romeo's banishment.
scenes.firstLine: Gallop apace, you fiery-footed steeds, Towards Phoebus' lodging!
scenes.lastLine: O serpent heart, hid with a flow'ring face!

characters.name: Juliet
characters.quote: O serpent heart, hid with a flow'ring face!

scenes.name: Friar Laurence's Plan
scenes.summary: Friar Laurence devises a plan to reunite Romeo and Juliet by faking Juliet's death.
scenes.firstLine: Hold, daughter. I do spy a kind of hope, Which craves as desperate an execution As that is desperate which we would prevent.
scenes.lastLine: Give me, give me! O, tell not me of fear!

characters.name: Friar Laurence
characters.quote: Hold, daughter. I do spy a kind of hope, Which craves as desperate an execution As that is desperate which we would prevent.

characters.name: Juliet
characters.quote: Give me, give me! O, tell not me of fear!

scenes.name: Juliet Takes the Potion
scenes.summary: Juliet, showing remarkable courage, takes the potion given by Friar Laurence.
scenes.firstLine: Farewell! God knows when we shall meet again.
scenes.lastLine: Romeo, Romeo, Romeo! Here's drink. I drink to thee.

characters.name: Juliet
characters.quote: Romeo, Romeo, Romeo! Here's drink. I drink to thee.

scenes.name: Romeo Learns of Juliet's Death
scenes.summary: Romeo, now in Mantua, is devastated by the news of Juliet's death, unaware of the Friar's plan.
scenes.firstLine: News from Verona!- How now, Balthasar! Dost thou not bring me letters from the friar?
scenes.lastLine: Well, Juliet, I will lie with thee to-night. Let's see for means.

characters.name: Romeo
characters.quote: Well, Juliet, I will lie with thee to-night. Let's see for means.

scenes.name: Juliet's Tomb
scenes.summary: Romeo enters Juliet's tomb, finds her seemingly lifeless body, and takes his own life.
scenes.firstLine: Give me that mattock and the wrenching iron.
scenes.lastLine: Here's to my love! [Drinks.] O true apothecary! Thy drugs are quick. Thus with a kiss I die.

characters.name: Romeo
characters.quote: Here's to my love! [Drinks.] O true apothecary! Thy drugs are quick. Thus with a kiss I die.

scenes.name: Juliet Awakens and Sees Romeo Dead
scenes.summary: Juliet wakes up to find Romeo dead by her side, leading her to take her own life with his dagger.
scenes.firstLine: O comfortable friar! where is my lord?
scenes.lastLine: This is thy sheath; there rust, and let me die.

characters.name: Juliet
characters.quote: This is thy sheath; there rust, and let me die.

scenes.name: The Aftermath
scenes.summary: The Capulet and Montague families discover the tragic fate of their children, leading to a reconciliation between the feuding houses.
scenes.firstLine: What's here? A cup, closed in my true love's hand?
scenes.lastLine: For never was a story of more woe than this of Juliet and her Romeo.

characters.name: Prince Escalus
characters.quote: Seal up the mouth of outrage for a while, Till we can clear these ambiguities

characters.name: Capulet
characters.quote: O brother Montague, give me thy hand.

characters.name: Montague
characters.quote: I will raise her statue in pure gold;

locations.name: Verona
locations.quote: In fair Verona, where we lay our scene, From ancient grudge break to new mutiny, Where civil blood makes civil hands unclean.

locations.name: Capulet's Orchard
locations.quote: But, soft! what light through yonder window breaks? It is the east, and Juliet is the sun.

locations.name: Friar Laurence's Cell
locations.quote: The grey-ey'd morn smiles on the frowning night, Check'ring the Eastern clouds with streaks of light; And flecked darkness like a drunkard reels From forth day's path and Titan's fiery wheels.

locations.name: Mantua
locations.quote: News from Verona!- How now, Balthasar! Dost thou not bring me letters from the friar?

locations.name: Capulet's Ball
locations.quote: Welcome, gentlemen! Ladies that have their toes Unplagu'd with corns will have a bout with you. Ah ha, my mistresses! which of you all Will now deny to dance?

locations.name: Juliet's Balcony
locations.quote: O Romeo, Romeo! wherefore art thou Romeo? Deny thy father and refuse thy name; Or, if thou wilt not, be but sworn my love, And I'll no longer be a Capulet.

characters.quote: O, I am fortune's fool!
characters.explanation: A deep, passionate red can represent his love and the bloodshed in his story.

characters.quote: O happy dagger! This is thy sheath; there rust, and let me die.
characters.explanation: A soft, yet poignant, rose pink embodies her innocence and the depth of her love.

characters.quote: A plague o' both your houses!
characters.explanation: A bold, fiery orange, symbolizing his dynamic presence and the chaos he foretells.

characters.quote: Mercutio, thou consort'st with Romeo.
characters.explanation: A dark, brooding maroon captures his aggression and the blood he spills.

characters.quote: Hold, daughter. I do spy a kind of hope, Which craves as desperate an execution As that is desperate which we would prevent.
characters.explanation: A sage green suggests his connection to the earth and the mixed outcomes of his interventions.

characters.quote: Tybalt, the kinsman to old Capulet, Hath sent a letter to his father's house.
characters.explanation: A calming sky blue, reflecting his efforts to bring peace among turbulent emotions and events.

characters.quote: Immediately we do exile him hence.
characters.explanation: A deep navy blue symbolizes his authoritative role and the somber duties he performs.

characters.quote: O brother Montague, give me thy hand.
characters.explanation: A rich burgundy conveys his deep-rooted connections and eventual turn towards reconciliation.

characters.quote: Alas, my liege, my wife is dead to-night; Grief of my son's exile hath stopp'd her breath.
characters.explanation: A subdued grey-blue captures his sorrow and the shadow of death that hangs over his family.
